name: Lemon Chicken and Rice Soup
description: The best kind of comfort in a bowl! It’s so cozy and heartwarming, using a whole chicken for the most amazing homemade broth!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt freshly ground black pepper (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken, onion, carrots, celery, garlic, bay leaves and 8 cups water in a large stockpot or Dutch oven; season with 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Place chicken, onion, carrots, celery, garlic, bay leaves and 8 cups water in a large stockpot or Dutch oven; season with 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until chicken is fork-tender, about 1 hour. Remove chicken and shred; discard skin and bones. Set aside. Strain broth through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until chicken is fork-tender, about 1 hour. Remove chicken and shred; discard skin and bones. Set aside. Strain broth through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids.

recipeInstructions.text: Return broth to the pot. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer. Stir in rice; cover and cook for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Return broth to the pot. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer. Stir in rice; cover and cook for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in chicken, carrots and celery. Cook, covered, until the rice is tender, about 10 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in chicken, carrots and celery. Cook, covered, until the rice is tender, about 10 more minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in dill and lemon juice; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in dill and lemon juice; season with salt and pepper, to taste.

review.reviewBody:
My daughter request the soup every other week. The liquid does get soaked in by the rice so I add extra at the end and when I have leftovers.  Also, I used a rotisserie chicken this time and it came out even better.  It’s a staple in my house.  Thank you. 

I also like lemon, so I add extra.

The flavors are perfect!! Exactly what I was craving!! I do have a question, though — about how much broth do you expect to be left with once you drain the solids? I lost way too much to evaporation!!!
Your soups never disappoint! I have made this a million times. So delish!
This soup was amazingly delicious! Everyone loved it, and they've already requested that I make it again soon. It's hard to imagine a better result after cooking dinner.

You don't need broth, you're going to make it while cooking the chicken. As a single person with a tiny european fridge, I made the recipe with two chicken thighs instead of the whole thing in a small pan, about 1/4 recipe, works super well!
Wondering if the photos of the soup with the slices of lemon were strictly for aesthetics? Should we add sliced lemon?

This recipe looked delicious, but I didn't have carrots or celery, so instead I used zucchini, potatoes, and mushroom, and it came out delicious! I love your recipes, and I look at them for hours every single day! Can't wait to try the actual recipe next time I go grocery shopping.
If I don’t have a stock pot, can I substitute the home made broth for a store bought cube? I know it wont taste as good but I’m really wanting to try this recipe!
